when there are too many serotonin receptors activated in the brain. The

combination of trazodone and certain antipsychotics, such as risperidone or

quetiapine, may increase the risk of serotonin syndrome. (2)

Orthostatic hypotension is a condition that occurs when there is a sudden drop

in blood pressure upon standing. The combination of trazodone and certain

antipsychotics, such as olanzapine or quetiapine, may increase the risk of

orthostatic hypotension. (3)

Interactions between Antipsychotics and Birth Control
